attributes.comment:
The proposed fee increase is absurd. Most of the adopting families have to file
TWICE because the original approval is only good for 18 months. If the fees are
increased, families will be forced to pay the following: I600A: $670 x 2 = $1340;
Fingerprints: $80 x 4 = $ 320 for a total of Total: $1660. That's an increase of $975
or over 140%! An exponentially high increase in cost without an increase in the
services provided by the USCIS. This increase will undoubtedly make it
impossible for many families to afford the already high cost of adoption, leaving
couples childless, and orphans without forever families.

Perhaps the government should re-align their priorities and allocate more funds to
control the influx of *illegal* immigrants into the USA, and stop punishing those
who pay the already high fees to bring immigrant orphans to this country legally
and out of love.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Kristy Baird
